data.event: Visited St. Catharines, Port Dalhousie, with Paul and Danielle. Photos are dated.

event.title: Worked at Erie Glass for Ron Stronks.
event.caption: Erie Glass

data.event: With a Postma-- not Steve, I think. Nice guy. Notes here Wonder what hes doing now? He was a good worker and showed me some of the ropes. I remember the first time we carried a new windows from the truck, it was too heavy for me-- we gripped it with gloves on the sides-- and I had to put it down for a second. I didnt know that putting it down on the concrete would destroy the "seal". Cost Ron Stronks a pretty penny, but he was pretty reasonable about it.

event.title: Worked at Lester B. Pearson Centre in Chatham.
event.caption: Worked at Lester B. Pearson Centre

data.event: Hired by Julie Farrell, who, I discovered by accident (going through filing cabinets), had connived her way into the position by telling staff she had been appointed assistant executive director by the previous executive director who had just been fired. Then revealing that the current CEO was having an affair with a board member. It was something like that. I met Susan Powers in waiting area, thought she was Julie, and had a charming conversation with her. Susan was Volunteer Coordinator.
Dont remember much. Was he on his way to apply for a teaching position somewhere? Maybe St. Catharines? From photos, I think. Yes, a photo on that sequence of negatives.

started with Trinity project... very strange situation. Through the Pearson Center, I met Joy Pyymaki and her staff and began doing occasional consulting work at the Womens Shelter. I will always remember that whenever I came to the front door, I was greeted with overt hostility, until the volunteer answering the door found out I was a consultant. Joy and Julie were both attempting to sabotage the project because they wanted the project funding for their own programs and they didnt like the director of Family Services.

event.title: Spoke from his cloak. Trinity Project Glen Audrey Turner.
event.caption: Pearson Centre Video Project - Glen and Audrey Turner

data.event: So she was 15 and six months. In my daybook from that time, notes about Ruth Baleka as video resource, Glen and Audrey Turner, who were going to play the parents. Later, a note about talking to Melanie, assuming Kranenburg. On the schedule for May 2, 10:00 a.m., video?
Pictures from this date, his left foot in a cast.

event.title: All You Need is Love at CDCSS
event.caption: Play at CDCSS

data.event: Cast party pictures at my house from this date. We watched video of play, which has been lost. The Elzinga boys were game to act in it but never got around to memorizing their lines.

event.title: Trip to Chicago
event.caption: Trip to Chicago to visit Meine.

data.event: In my day book from that time. I dont see any pictures, possibly because they are miss-dated or I didnt take any. This picture is from a trip in June 1986.

Picture dated 1988-07, probably right after we bought it (being waxed). It was time to replace the Lada, which we eventually sold to Len Moelker no earlier than July 1989-- there is video if it in the garage at 116 Tissiman. But the Fairmont had problems stalling in wet weather. Referred to in very funny Christmas letter, 1988. Hard to find a picture but the Malibu replaced it and its definitely there by 1989-07. Helen had an accident with it 1989-06
Trip with Grandpa and Grandma Schat.

event.title: LPC Staff Retreat at the Guild in Scarborough.
event.caption: Photo

data.event: Very strange weekend at this retreat facility. There was a pool A singalong in someones room with my guitar, and Mark Raggs guitar: mostly me, Brad, Mark. The video is a good guide as to who was there at the time.
At one point Roger, who was dreaming the entire time, almost kissed Mr. Vanderende, after guiding him to his seat, and he almost kissed him back.

event.title: Helens accident- Fairmont.
event.description: Helen had an accident with it 1989-06.
event.caption: Photo

data.event: Helen had an accident with the 1978 Ford Fairmont wagon. I think it was the result of backing into the highway from Dreises place. Damaged the bumper.

Christmas letter from 1989 confirms it. Purchased from Strings and Things. My first one was a dud. They replaced it with the much nicer ash-colored model I own today. This picture is from 1996, seven years later.

There is a picture dated 1991 showing the Malibu in driveway. Christmas letter from 1989 confirms: we bought Malibu that year! Helens dad heard from George Antuma that someone had traded in this nice Malibu and the dealer was willing to sell it to us for the trade-in value he gave on it. About $3,000 I think. It was a pretty good deal.

Paul Vanderkooy moved to Chatham, teaching at CCS, with Helen. We connected somewhere and started jamming together. I believe I first started jamming with Brad, and then Paul joined us. Around this time, Susan Vanderkooy began to "recover" memories of sexual abuse by her father. In retrospect, the "recovered" portion of this episode raises suspicions. Susan eventually left Paul for someone else and lived with him in GR. They might have gotten back together eventually. They now live in Nova Scotia.

A really nice house, with a wonderful barn/garage out back, a tree-house, sand-box, garden. Great space for us at the time. The second floor of the barn was a great storage area. There was a ladder that you pulled down with a rope. Lots of workbench space.
Video dated July 7, 1989 shows Nikki 1 in the backyard with the kids. He is 3.5 months old on this date. This is definitely at 116 Tisssiman, so the photo is dated wrong.

Recorded with Brad Davis, Fred Feyen, Paul Vanderkooy, Lara Schat. We rehearsed at our house for some time before recording. Really was a great experience. Steve Fowler and Sean Meriano engineered. The studio was owned by Tony Meriano. Strings and Things was owned by Tony Meriano and Clint Benoot. Recording engineer was Steve Fowler.
In Chatham, at apartment, of heart attack.
At Jun and Karin’s. There is a video.

With Lara and Greg Groen, Brad Davis, Fred Feyen, Paul Vanderkooy. At the Chatham Cultural Center, in the Green room. Michelle kept telling me that some of the Pearson Center were rude and made fun of us, but the CRC crowded appeared to really like it. Greg Groen was a huge mistake: he couldnt play straight.
I videotaped it for her using LPC camcorder probably. I remember hearing that he was a jerk and that Polly was somewhat desperate.
Pretty good video of Bill, Meine, Kathy wandering campus. Engaged with students wandering around. Checked out all the dorms, the new library.
A few years later, the staff unionized, and Julie Farrell was eventually dismissed.

Laura Callingham, Tom Coatsworth, Steve and Noreen Donnell, Steve Repuski, Stacey Stevenson, Marg Dupuis, Erica Henderson, Scott, Peter, Louis, Candace, and more. I wrote a play, "The Last Chauvinist", which received approval from Theatre Kent for production in the green room-- not the main stage. But we moved before it could go.
According to Christmas Letter. "We" saw him. Was there a time we saw him with Ann and Al? Maybe that was at Roy Thompson Hall.
(!) And move to Hamilton. Reported in 1993 Christmas letter.
Laura Dommasch married to Brad Crichton. I video-taped the wedding. Danielle was flower girl. Date from letter is pretty darn close. Dont have exact day yet.

Of cancer. There was, for a time, a fervent belief that a "miracle" had happened and she was cured. It came back with a vengeance. She died at home. Sid called the girls in to see her after she died. Thats a detail I remember.

(!) After interview with Don Janzen, then Murray MacKenzie and Noel Churchman. I replaced Ted Robbins as Office Manger. Ted also worked with Xerox managing computers. Ted went full-time facilities, I believe.

There is a bw picture from 1997-12 showing 1984 Accord fender damage. Purchased July 22, 1994. Really liked driving it: very nice feel on the road. Broke down in Harriston where I bumped into Henry Westendorp, who invited me to his house for dinner, while trying to help me get it running. Eventually had to go to dealer: it was the timing belt.

Moved there from Chatham, until move to 11 Ramblewood Way 1999. Lovely house on a court, nice pool for the kids, open field behind us (later filled by a condo). A house we liked a lot, though it was not large. The pool was great. Good neighborhood. Our kids played lots of ball hockey and other games with the neighbors, including Barney, Sarah, Beverly, Yann and Emmanual...
I video taped it. Pictures. Including a very pregnant Karin. Alexander must have been born in next few weeks.
Pretty sure. Alexander Terado born, Toronto.
From Rade something. In database.
Originally labelled 1985 but-- the Honda Accord! Just Helen and I, with new camcorder, I think. Shot river, cottage, town of Tweed. Video with date!
Picture of Michael-- must be my last photo of him.
Christmas - New Years in Kitchener, we went skating at Victoria Park with the Van Eeks and the Tensens. From video, with date on it, meaning it was our second Christmas in Kitchener.
Saw the Immigrants perform live in Hamilton I believe, possibly at Redeemer. Paul Hogeterp.
(!) Went to a Blue Jays game, vs. Boston. This photo is dated accurately.
At Redeemer College. At least, the reception was there. The wedding itself was in a church. Kim later worked at Christian Horizons West District Office for a while, with Monique.
Centre in the Square. From calendar, saw Bare Naked Ladies with kids at Center in the Square. Note the relative address for full-sized image works!

We obtained the dog from Otto at LHCS, nice guy. After a time, we found the kids couldnt really handle him and he chewed up everything in the back yard. Besides, he peed every time I just looked at him and opened my mouth-- so we brought him to the pound. Sadly.

The Camry replaced the Malibu, not the 1984 Accord. Few pictures of it. The engine caught fire on the way home from CH one day; we had it towed and disposed of, I believe. We replaced it with the 1987 4Runner.
Jennifer and Bob married in Niagara Falls.
(!) Bills 40th birthday party, Kitchener. Lots of guests. Maybe last time that kind of gathering in my honor!

Bruce somethings jazz combo. Usually rehearsed at University of Guelph, where we drove him in 4Runner, then waited at coffee shop. Progressive jazz band that played around town occasionally. Tribute to.. Duke Ellington, I think. Date is informed guess.
Two sets of ski pictures, same outfits-- were there two trips that year? Seems like it.

event.title: Christopher in School Play.
event.description: Christopher acted in LHCS school play.
event.caption: Christopher in School Play

data.event: I believe we have a video.

Two sets of ski pictures, same outfits-- were there two trips that year? Seems like it. Pauls poles are different in the second set, so probably. Unless that was the time he dropped them from the lift.
To Sean and Melanie.

We had acquired the Camry earlier to replace the Malibu. Start date pretty good. There is a photo of the 4Runner with the 1984 Accord, then, AFTER, the Camry. So the Camry replaced the Malibu by 1996-06. We kept the Malibu for a while to try to sell it but nobody wanted it, so we junked it. The Camry caught fire and the 4Runner replaced it. But 1997-06 film set shows 4Runner WITH the Accord, then ten frames later, the Camry in Paris, which, I think was about when we bought it. Did it replace the 1984 Accord?

Including Bay of Fundy, Halifax, Cape Breton, and PEI. with Paul, Christopher, Danielle. Not exact dates here. We did go whale-watching twice. The second time whale-watching with a kind of crazy guy in a smaller inflatable, pontoon boat, with a German couple and their daughter. Quite the experience, actually.
Crucible at Eastwood. In Calendar. Paul was in it, not sure which character And he might have been the male lead. Photos are generic, snagged from internet.

event.title: Nikki still there.
event.description: When did we get rid of him?
event.caption: Nikki

data.event: From pictures.
So Paul could have old study as bedroom. Also, space for new desk.

event.title: Skiing at Mount St. Louis Moonstone.
event.caption: Skiing Mount St. Louis Moonstone

data.event: From pictures. Danielle got lost and it took hours to find her.
Photos at Champlain Lake show short hair, but May 1998 shows long. Resolve.
Paul was dating Joanne at this time.
Dated picture of him in the little basket. Christopher bought him with his own money from a place in Harriston, I think, where he and I picked him up. Date we had him put down is not at all precise.
Cool picture with waterproof camera.
Wedding at Niagara-on-the-Lake, in Courthouse Theatre.
Thus she was born in 1923, March 14.
While picking up Paul. I was allegedly at fault but witnesses and I believe the car was speeding coming over a curvy hill. Dated according to back of photo.
No real data here. Are there any pictures after this date with Nikki in them? He was destroying everything he could reach in the back yard, including bicycles, fences, wooden slats.
Vacation at Lake Champlain, Ontario.
Big gathering at Queenston with extended Van Dyk families. Did not repeat it.
1999 Accord - leased from Honda. Date uncertain, but it was new. Leased new from dealership. DX model. After Christophers accident, replaced it with a more luxurious 2001 Accord EX.

The deal, negotiated by Cathleen, turned all our old furniture in for the new, ugly dark re stuff. I persuaded the furniture dealer in Cambridge to sell me back the IKEA desk for what what they got for it, something like $120. I doubt they really wanted it anyway.
Cash. Danielle is 15.
We hired Mikes movers, but they vastly underestimated amount of work and we were still moving late into the night. Mortgage paid off February 2012.

event.title: Uncle William Bol died in Holland.
event.caption: Uncle William died.

data.event: Mom went to Holland to be with him at the end. He was 80 years old.

event.title: Cowboy Junkies at Riverrun, Guelph.
event.caption: Cowboy Junkies at Riverrun in Guelph

data.event: With Sara Kraft, Danielle. Had pictures taken with Margo Timmins afterwards.
In 1990, she was listed as one of the 50 most beautiful people in the world. Yes, thats me!
Which brought an end to my participation in the Cohen newsgroup. I still think it was a terrific "event", with a great combination of music, panels, walking tours, and open mic sessions.
As a project for an art class, Paul paints a copy of the Mona Lisa, on same size board, same materials.
Several pictures, 4Runner included.

With Christopher and Danielle, in the 4Runner. The transmission blew around Moose Jaw and we had to spend a night or two in a motel waiting for repairs. We went all the way to Tofino, stopping off to see Al and Theresa, and Karin and Jun. Paul stayed home to attend to a job and gigs. We generally camped along the way, including a cold night in the mountains.
Shortly afterwards... was this after Joanna? I think so.

Shot with vx-2000, TRV-900 sennheiser wireless mics, with Jim Van Elswyk on second camera. The video turned out well, but the reception was severely marred by Steve Plaums father preaching a long, dreary sermon about the snares of the world.

event.title: Tree fell over in back yard.
event.caption: Tree falls over in backyard.

data.event: (!) It was shortly afterwards that we planted the blue spruce and the kids gave us the Japanese Maple in the front. Use for dating.

Basically, acquired to replace 4Runner, but we kept 4Runner for some time for Paul and for general use as 3rd car until the clutch finally blew near Van Eeks house, I believe. Eventually, Paul assumed ownership of the Civic as he moved to Montreal. A mechanic there convinced him to have the timing belt replaced without him asking us-- we had just replaced it before giving him the car.

First trip to Newfoundland. We toured Gros Morne and St. Johns, camping mostly. We did stay in a nice cabin in Twillingate, for a very reasonable amount. And saw a ridiculously delightful musical presentation like "Hee Haw" with dinner-- a terrific salmon meal.
From ticket! Blue Jays Game, three of us. Probably me, Paul,and Danielle.

I did the video for them. Roses dad did not like having a video of the wedding. I think he thought it was somewhat sacrilegious. Roses brother sang "The Promise" by Tracey Chapman at the reception, which was more relevant than most people probably knew.
(^) With all three kids. Very nice private beach. Great ice cream at Facquars.
Notes here. Some time around here.
It did take until December for surgery. When was surgery exactly?
At Fred and Hennies.
I did the video for them, which was one of my better ones, I believe. It must have been Saturday the 19th, right?

event.title: Saw Nellie McKay in Toronto at El Mocambo.
event.caption: Photo

data.event: Saw Nellie McKay in Toronto, for the second time (certain). Exact date, from Review on Canoe. Lara was there, with Danielle probably, as was Johan De Zoete, and some others I think. Very funny and entertaining. We went again shortly afterwards to see her at Lees Palace with Helen. Cant find exact date for that. The photo is from the Lees Palace show we saw in June.
(^) dates approximate. Really enjoyed Caraquet, a sort of Black Creek Pioneer Village, but better. Barrel makers, cloth, blacksmiths, etc.
(!) , Port Perry, Ontario. I shot wedding video. What is exact date? 2004-08-07!

event.title: Johan and Rhoda married Dundas, Ontario.
event.caption: Johan and Rhoda married.

data.event: I shot wedding video. I also sang, "Im Your Man", I think, with Matthew and Johan.
Ran into Rick and Stacey who were also there. Dated picture.
Shot with my Nikon FG. Cant find negatives for after this date. Actually, quite sure there are other pictures later, but, getting close.
Reminder of the thousands of times we are greeted by this edifice.
(!) Christopher had an accident with the Accord. While leaving Teutech, not his fault. Accord was totalled and we replaced it with a 2001 Accord EX, much nicer options.

event.title: 2001 Accord to replace leased 1999 Accord DX.
event.caption: 2001 Accord

data.event: Bought used from someone in new subdivision north-west of here. Stick shift, the ex version, which was quite nice. Nicer than our 1999.
(!) Danielle gets her first car, a 1998 Toyota Corolla. Christopher works at Teutech, Guelph. I remember being very annoyed at Helen second-guessing the choice of car, the price, etc..

event.title: New York City - Paul and Danielle.
event.description: Sinister conspiracy to deceive us all.
event.caption: New York City with Paul and Danielle

data.event: We did the bus tour, which was actually fun-- we had a good guide. Then a boat tour around Manhattan island. Greenwich village, WTC, Central Park where we found Lennons memorial. Danielle had to return something to someone in New York and she and Paul courageously went off by themselves via subway to do that, meeting us later at Macys on 34th Street.
(!) Skiiing in Collingwood - I took video. With Paul, Danielle, and Christopher.

event.title: Maartje Van Dyk died in Grimsby.
event.caption: Maartje Van Dyk died in Grimsby.

data.event: I visited her shortly before, as she was essentially in a coma. I had also come back early from a course in Ottawa to do so, through terrible traffic and weather. Photo was taken on December 15th.
(!) At the Royal Botanical Gardens, indoors. Jaw-dropping cleavage by Joanne. I did the video for the wedding. Pretty informal, irreverent affair.

Actually, to a motel in a small town north of Boston, York Beach, at Cutty Sark Hotel. Best part was a visit to Salem, where actors recreated, on the street, and then the courthouse, a witch capture and trial. Also went to Boston Aquarium.
In Port Elgin? Marriage fell apart, not unexpectedly. His Uncle gave the rudest most vulgar wedding reception speech I have ever heard. I video taped the wedding.
It rained quite a bit during this outdoor ceremony in a park but Cathenia was determined to not move indoors. The minister actually asked for a miracle-- stop the rain! And it started raining harder.
The end of the 4Runner. Clutch, I think, blew out. Too many other problems (especially tailgate, window, etc.) to justify further investment.

event.title: Peter Paul and Mary at Roy Thompson Hall.
event.caption: Peter Paul and Mary

data.event: Peter Paul and Mary at Roy Thompson Hall. Concert at Roy Thomson Hall with Peter Paul and Mary.
Brilliant production. Date not certain. But probably close.
New table and chairs, bought by Helen from want ads, with chairs. Very nice. About $600 if I remember correctly.
Exact dates. I set them up together. One of the daughters, I believe the second one, gave a very inappropriate speech at the reception, joking about catching them in delecti on the couch one night.
Exact date.
At St. Michaels in Toronto. One week recovery. Recovery took longer than expected-- about a week. Recipient doing well.

event.title: Trip to BC with Al and Ann.
event.description: Ending on Vancouver Island at Karins birthday party near Comox.
event.caption: B.C. Trip

data.event: Dates from pictures - July 20 to August 4. There was a bizarre incident with one of Karins close friends-- an inappropriate kiss or something, and an allusion to lesbianesque desire. We rented a very nice vehicle in Calgary, with a GPS, and returned from Victoria. I drove most of the time because Ann didnt trust Als driving. In fact, once, in Victoria, I wanted to switch because I was tired and sleepy but Ann strenuously objected --because we were in the city-- and I kept driving.

event.title: 2004 Corolla
event.description: Replacement for the CIVIC which we sold to Paul.
event.caption: 2004 Corolla

data.event: Exact date: photo taken in the car lot. Purchased 2004 Corolla from Carimex in Kitchener.
